snippet: Ukraine’s acting prime minister abandoned threats to forcibly evict pro-Russian demonstrators from government buildings.
abstract: Acting Ukrainian Prime Min Arseniy P Yatsenyuk abandons threats to forcibly evict pro-Russian demonstrators from government buildings; assures political and business leaders in the country's rebellious east that they will get more power to run their own affairs.

byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn contributed reporting from Moscow, Neil MacFarquhar from Simferopol, Crimea, and Mark Landler from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Ukraine’s acting prime minister abandoned threats to forcibly evict pro-Russian demonstrators from government buildings.

headline.main: Pro-Russia Ukrainians Are Promised More Power, but Remain Dubious
headline.print_headline: Pro-Russia Ukrainians Are Promised More Power, but Remain Dubious
